titlestmt.titleproper: Crossgates Regional Shopping Mall Collection; ead apap067
titlestmt.author: Marion P. Munzer

publicationstmt.publisher: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-28 16:40:17 -0400.

change.item: Encoded in EAD by Marion P. Munzer

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Materials relating to the application of the Pyramid Crossgates Company to the New York State DEC and DOT for permits to build the Crossgates Regional Shopping Mall in the Albany Pine Bush.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed in 1994 by Marion P. Munzer.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: First proposed in 1978, the Crossgates Mall is a shopping mall located in the Albany suburb of Guilderland, New York, near or in the Albany Pine Push area. The mall opened on March 4, 1984, and in October 1994 underwent a large expansion that nearly doubled its size. An additional 1998 expansion was dropped due to environmental concerns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This Collection consists of materials relating to the application of the Pyramid Crossgates Company to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation and Department of Transportation for permits to build the Crossgates Regional Shopping Mall in the Albany Pine Bush.

The Collection begins with a 1979 report on a review of archaeological and historical literature. The most extensive of the studies and reports is the draft environmental impact statement with its fourteen appendices. The applications, responses, and decisions are of importance. The Stenographic Record on the hearings provide information on the legal developments. Historical maps are included, together with maps and photographs of the actual area or of models. Clippings from newspapers and periodicals have been added to the collection for the convenience of researchers and to bring information in the collection up to 1984 when the shopping mall opened.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Arrangement within the two series is chronological except for the maps (arranged by topics) and the photographs (arranged as labeled).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Except for the clippings, all of the items in the Collection were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, as one of the six locations where these documents were available for public inspection at the time of the hearings.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Crossgates Regional Shopping Mall Collection, 1979-1985. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Crossgates Regional Shopping Mall Collection).

controlaccess.corpname: New York (State). Department of Environmental Conservation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series includes draft environmental impact statements, responses and decisions. Maps and photographs of the actual area and of models are also included. Clippings are from newspapers and periodicals and deal with the application, the Albany Pine Bush, and the opening of the shopping mall.

did.unittitle: Stenographic Record for the State of New York Department of Environmental Conservation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is the transcript of proceedings at public hearings. Page numbering is consecutive for the entire record.
